meanings.definition: Relating to the medieval code of knighthood.
meanings.sent1: The knight's armor had a chivalric design, reflecting the values of honor and bravery.
meanings.sent2: The chivalric tales of King Arthur and his knights are famous for their noble deeds.
meanings.sent3: In the chivalric world of knights, even dragons were known to appreciate good manners.
meanings.sent4: Her chivalric spirit shone like a beacon of light in the darkness of deceit.
meanings.sent5: The chivalric oath to protect the weak was etched in his heart forever.

meanings.definition: Characterized by honor, courtesy, and courage.
meanings.sent1: The chivalric knight always treated others with respect and kindness.
meanings.sent2: His chivalric behavior towards his enemies earned him admiration from all.
meanings.sent3: Even in the face of danger, his chivalric demeanor never wavered.
meanings.sent4: The chivalric bond between the two friends was unbreakable, built on trust and loyalty.
meanings.sent5: Her chivalric actions spoke louder than any words could.

meanings.definition: Behaving in a noble and courteous manner.
meanings.sent1: The chivalric gentleman always held the door open for others.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her chivalric gestures, always putting others before herself.
meanings.sent3: His chivalric conduct at the royal ball impressed everyone in attendance.
meanings.sent4: The chivalric way he defended the weak made him a hero in the eyes of many.
meanings.sent5: In a world full of deceit, her chivalric nature stood out like a rare gem.
